verses.roman:
ajā gāvo mahiṣyaś ca
nirviśantyo vanād vanam
īṣīkāṭavīṁ nirviviśuḥ
krandantyo dāva-tarṣitāḥ

synonyms: ajāḥ—the goats; gāvaḥ—the cows; mahiṣyaḥ—the buffalo; ca—and; nirviśantyaḥ—entering; vanāt—from one forest; vanam—to another forest; īṣīkā-aṭavīm—a forest of canes; nirviviśuḥ—they entered; dāva—because of a forest fire; tarṣitāḥ—thirsty .
translation: Passing from one part of the great forest to another, the goats, cows and buffalo eventually entered an area overgrown with sharp canes. The heat of a nearby forest fire made them thirsty, and they cried out in distress.
